Luna Fire Information

This website provides up-to-the-minute information on the Luna Fire, in New Mexico's Taos and Colfax counties. This website is updated every ten minutes. Last updated: 2020-10-18 16:47:05 -0600 MDT

Current total acreage: 7,445 acres

Maps

Infrared Satellites

May be delayed by up to 12 hours. Red is most recent.

Live Imaging Satellite (GOES)

More Information Sources

  • Fire, Weather and Avalanche Center
  • Carson National Forest
  • Angel Fire Fire Department
  • Taos News

What is This?

This website aggregates information from many sources on the Luna Fire, which is currently burning in Taos and Colfax counties in New Mexico.

This site only posts official fire information and easily verified factual claims (e.g. air assets verified by ADS-B, photos of the fire, etc).

This website is built and maintained by Nate Berkopec, a resident of the Taos area. It is not official information and should not be quoted directly.

This is a free and open source project. You can contribute on GitHub.

Luna (NM-CAF), new, 10,000+ acres, located 13 miles SE of Taos, NM (36.2642, -105.3394). AA, 1 T1 Helo, 4 T1 or 2IA Crews on order.

Fuel Type: High Elevation Mixed Spruce down to Ponderosa Pine
Values at Risk: Values at risk currently being assessed#LunaFire currently burning at 11,000 elevation to 9,000 elevation. The fuel source is high elevation mixed Spruce down to Ponderosa Pine.#NMFire
